alert.note: Alert for Garfield; Wayne (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 30 at 4:26PM MDT until June 30 at 5:00PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR NORTHEASTERN GARFIELD AND SOUTH CENTRAL WAYNE COUNTIES...SPECIFICALLY PORTIONS OF CAPITOL REEF NATIONAL PARK... At 426 PM MDT, National Park Rangers at Capitol Reef National Park reported flash flooding occurring in Sheets Gulch, Five Mile Wash, Cottonwood Wash, and Burro Wash. Additionally, water is flowing across the Notam-Bullfrom Road where it turns from pavement to dirt. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of slot canyons and normall dry washes. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Capitol Reef National Park, Notam-Bullfrog road FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Dry washes, streams, and rivers can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
